posts.post_content:
Sentinels seem to take the "Drake" roll of Artifacts of being the "Not-worth-the-cost" creature. (Mostly and entirely referring to [Bladed Sentinel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bladed Sentinel). Sorry, I fail History assignments for not having enough sources).  
  
However, unlike my pathetic friend, This is a Golem, and can still be used with the Splicers. It also could be used as a general card for any deck, considering it's artifact-ness, but why does it have a negative effect?  
  
This leads me to believe the Magic world is really messed up. Sure, it's rusted, fine. However, these artisans and creators of these machines are pretty inefficient, since it seems like they can't make something without it partially backfiring, and here comes [Rune-Scarred Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune-Scarred Demon), flaunting his awesomeness of just about being a 6/6 flyer for 5 CMC with [Demonic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Tutor) attached. I thought Demon's were supposed to have negative effects, while machines are perfect! Things like this put [Lord of](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Posted By: j_mindfingerpainter (1/24/2012 6:06:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like the "enters tapped" drawback. It's usually good for +1/+1, and the effects are temporary. As long as blue creatures stink, cards like this will always be playable.  
  
On a side note: we say that no one ever blocks, but playing a card like this really makes you realize exactly how often you expect summoning sick creatures to supply some D.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: "Enters the battliefield tapped" is actually a lot more prohibitive than it seems at first. Despite the fact that most creatures can't attack on the first turn, this prevents haste entirely, and keeps you from blocking, with what would honestly make a nice blocker on turn 4.

posts.post_content: This is uncommon for two reasons. One, a 3/4 for four is a bit good for Blue. Two, artifacts are magical items. You don't go around finding a whole bunch of magically enchanted objects, except maybe on Mirrodin, since everything there's metal.
posts.html:
